edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend
Interface BackEndLSP

All Known Implementing Classes:
BackEndLSPAdapter
public interface BackEndLSP

An interface representing the back end of the LSP; the wrapper onto the legacy collection. This interface is the starting point for all back-end wrapper developers - they subclass and implement it, so that it can communicate with the FrontEndLSP above it. The two classes communicate using LSPObjects of various types.

The FrontEndLSP can have one or more BackEndLSPs underneath it. These interfaces all look the same to it, and it queries them without regard to internal implementation. Implementation is up to the developer, but guidelines as described below must be followed.

See Also:
edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.frontend, edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common

initialize

public void initialize(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String description,
                       java.lang.String[] queryLanguages)
                throws BackEndException
According to SDLIP, every subcollection must have a name, a description, and one or more (computer) query languages it responds to. This method is used to set these values when the BackEndLSP is first constructed. It should not be called more than once.

This is also a good place for the BackEndLSP to load any configuration files, indexes, etc., that it might need, and to configure itself accordingly.

Parameters:
name - the name of the subcollection; this is the same name that should appear in the sdarts_config.xml file when an instance is registered
description - the description of the subcollection
queryLanguages - the (computer) query languages the subcollection responds to
Throws:
BackEndException - if something goes wrong
